item.title: Social Factors
item.description: Main Findings Food Access According to EcoDistricts (2016), a food desert is a community where more than 20 percent of residents are living below the poverty threshold and at least 33 percent of the population lives more than a mile from a supermarket. Pollution Pollution is found to have multiple ties to major health issues. It can serve as an indicator for later in life chronic issues such as heart and respiratory diseases.

Petersburg Wellness Consortium The Petersburg Wellness Consortium raises consciousness about health factors and outcomes by empowering community members, sharing capacity-building resources and creating partnerships that promote a healthy community. There focus groups include: Chronic Disease, Oral Health, Youth Health It was launched in Fall 2012 by Dr.Maghboeba Mosavel The organization, which is made up of a alliance of stakeholders and WE (academic-community partnership), uses collective resources to try to improve the overall health of Petersburg

UVA Data Science for the Public Good Program The Data Science for the Public Good (DSPG) Young Scholars program is a summer immersive program held at the Biocomplexity Institute’s Social and Decision Analytics division (SDAD). In its seventh year, the program engages students from across the country to work together on projects that address state, federal, and local government challenges around critical social issues relevant in the world today. DSPG young scholars conduct research at the intersection of statistics, computation, and the social sciences to determine how information generated within every community can be leveraged to improve quality of life and inform public policy.
